SafetyInspectionBy: Wis. Dept of Commerce Dept of Safety & Buildings

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Dry, Condensed, and Evaporated Dairy Product Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Process:
ConAgra Foods Packaged Foods LLC.                      
This Facility is a food processing plant that runs continuously. The regulated substance under the RMP rule is Anhydrous Ammonia (CAS #7664-41-7). Anhydrous Ammonia is used exclusively as a refrigerant for cooling purposes in both production and storage areas. There are two separate refrigeration systems on site, operating independent of one another. Both systems are a closed loop with normal operating pressures of less than 200 PSI. The North Plant system (process) has a maximum charge of 13,687 lbs, of ammonia contained throughout it. The South Plant system (process) has a maximum charge of 14,707 lbs, of ammonia contained throughout it. The remaining 1,400 lbs are stored outdoors in ten 140 lb D.O.T. certified blue cylinders. These cylinders are in a locked steel mesh cage.
Quantity: Maximum quantities on-site for the regulated substance are
Ammonia (Anhydrous) 29,794 lbs.
Toxic Worse Case Scenario
When doing our toxic worst case scenario we considered the possibility of the High Pressure Receiver (HPR) losing all the ammonia stored in it. The high pressure receiver normal inventory is approx  5000 lbs of ammonia. In the event that we released all the ammonia stored in the HPR due to a relief valve releasing we considered all sources to the toxic endpoint. This included environmental receptors as well as public.
Toxic Alternate case
When computing our toxic alternate case we considered a more probable release than the worst case scenario. The release study included all public and environmental receptors that would be affected.
Flammable Worst Case
Anhydrous Ammonia is not considered a flammable substance unless Lower Explosive Limit (LEL)  & Upper Explosive Limits (UEL) are met. We have ammonia detection systems that automatically turns on exhaust fans in the engine rooms as well as several production areas. Most of the plant also has sprinkler systems through out for fire suppression.
Accidental Re

lease History:
None to report
Emergency Response Procedures:
ConAgra Foods Packaged Foods LLC. of Menomonie WI.  Has established an in-house level A emergency response "HAZMAT" team to quickly respond to and handle releases of Anhydrous Ammonia.  The established steps include initial training under the OSHA regulation 29 CFR 1910.120 "HAZWOPER".  The facility has also established annual retraining for all personnel that are on the HAZMAT Team as well as periodic spill drills and plant wide evacuation drills to assure all employees are prepared in the event of an emergency.  ConAgra Foods Packaged Foods LLC. has also established training with the Fire Department personnel and community Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC).  These established plans and procedures shall be periodically reviewed to assure that they are current and up to date. The Dunn County LEPC reviewed the site plan on April 28 of 2009.
General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps: ConAgra Foods Packaged Foods LLC.  have complied with the EPA Risk Management Program and also the OSHA Process Safety Management regulations CFR 1910.119 & 1910.120 to assure that the Ammonia Refrigeration System is well maintained and employees are properly trained and periodically retrained to assure they are kept up to date on any changes and new operations that may affect them.  The ammonia compressors automatically shut down if the pressure exceeds 200 PSI. The relief valves are preset at 250 PSI where applicable. ConAgra Foods Packaged Foods LLC practices the following industry codes and standards.
ASME Boiler & Pressure Valve Codes.
ANSI B31.1 & B31.5 Piping Codes.
IIAR industry guideline for safety and good engineering practices.
NFPA guidelines for fire protection equipment.
National Electric Code NEC for safe electrical installations and maintenance.
Through regular audits, training, maintenance, testing, and inspection programs the ammonia refrigeration system at Con

Agra Foods Packaged Foods LLC. has established a history of safe operation and that community emergency action plans are current and training with community services is done for a safe response in the event of an accidental release.
Emergency Response Program:
In house Level A HAZMAT Team
Primary Public Emergency Responders:
City Fire Department:
City Hazardous Material Response Team:
City Law Enforcement:
County Sheriffs Department:
City and County Ambulance Service:
Dunn County LEPC
Special Resources Available from Facility:
ConAgra Foods Packaged Foods LLC. has purchased Four Level A Chemical Suits, Self-Contained Breathing Apparatus and other appropriate equipment to support the in-house level A HAZMAT team.  This team will coordinate their efforts with the outside emergency agencies and or services to assure the safety of all. All members of the HAZMAT Team have been trained in The National Incident Command System (NIMS ) and many have taken the IS-700 test and received their certificates from FEMA.
